headline: J.D. Vance Wondered Whether Trump Was ‘America’s Hitler,’ Says Former Roommate Sharing Screenshot
author: Nick Evans
sentences:
In the screenshot, Vance described his party as “whether we like it or not, the party of lower-income, lower-education white people,” and argued “Trump is the fruit of the party’s collective neglect.”
Although Vance’s feelings toward the former president have made a complete turnaround, echoes of those frustrations with the party remain a feature in his pitch to voters.

He regularly jokes there’s an evil party and stupid party in Washington — occasionally they get together to do something stupid and evil and they call it bipartisanship.
